intro: Pavetta akeassii, commonly known as the Akeassii pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and feature five white petals with prominent yellow stamens. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
